org.transitime.core

Class TemporalDifference

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.TemporalDifference

  • public class TemporalDifference
extends java.lang.Object
    For keeping track of how far off a vehicle is from the expected time. For schedule adherence and for determining temporal matches.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TemporalDifference(int temporalDifferenceMsec) 
      TemporalDifference(long temporalDifferenceMsec)
      Often working with longs for time so it is convenient to have a constructor that will accept a long as the temporal difference.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean betterThan(TemporalDifference other)
      Returns if the temporal difference for this object is better than that for the TemporalDifference parameter other.
      boolean betterThanOrEqualTo(TemporalDifference other)
      Returns if the temporal difference for this object is better than or equal to that for the TemporalDifference parameter other.
      int getTemporalDifference()
      Returns the temporalDifferenceMsec in msec.
      boolean isWithinBounds()
      Returns true if the temporal difference is within the bounds specified by CoreConfig.getAllowableEarlySeconds() and CoreConfig.getAllowableLateSeconds().
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TemporalDifference

        public TemporalDifference(int temporalDifferenceMsec)
        Parameters:
        temporalDifferenceMsec - Positive means vehicle is ahead of where expected, negative means behind.

      • TemporalDifference

        public TemporalDifference(long temporalDifferenceMsec)
        Often working with longs for time so it is convenient to have a constructor that will accept a long as the temporal difference.
        Parameters:
        temporalDifferenceMsec - Positive means vehicle is ahead of where expected, negative means behind.

    • Method Detail

      • isWithinBounds

        public boolean isWithinBounds()
        Returns true if the temporal difference is within the bounds specified by CoreConfig.getAllowableEarlySeconds() and CoreConfig.getAllowableLateSeconds().
        Returns:
        true if within bounds

      • betterThan

        public boolean betterThan(TemporalDifference other)
        Returns if the temporal difference for this object is better than that for the TemporalDifference parameter other.
        Parameters:
        other - TemporalDifference to be compared to

        public boolean betterThanOrEqualTo(TemporalDifference other)
        Returns if the temporal difference for this object is better than or equal to that for the TemporalDifference parameter other.
        Parameters:
        other - TemporalDifference to be compared to
        Returns:

      • getTemporalDifference

        public int getTemporalDifference()
        Returns the temporalDifferenceMsec in msec. Positive means vehicle is early and negative means that vehicle is late.
        Returns:
